intro: Hebenstretia spicata, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of violet, pink, and white, often with a contrasting throat. Its leaves are typically velvety and dark green, arranged in a rosette pattern. Hebenstretia spicata thrives in humid, well-drained soil and prefers indirect sunlight.
